commit_message:
Convert all class usage to relative names

In Puppet 3 there was a need to use absolute
names to prevent issues. Since Puppet 4 everything
is absolute by default which makes this not needed.

We need to change this everywhere so that we can
revert the pin in [1] that now prevents us from
using the latest version of the puppet-lint check
puppet-lint-absolute_classname_check that properly
checks that we dont use absolute names.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697742/

Change-Id: I78b74fbeb08be7234189e4d266412fb7fb7a73c0

commit_message:
Auto refresh, part 2

1.Add auto refresh to table pages
2.Change old unit test related to the table
3.Add unit test jasmine(dev_server_ip:port/jasmine-legacy)

In identity/users/tests.py tests expected 'get_default_domain' to be
called 2 times. but, when WebDriverWait waiting for element,
those functions will be auto called with auto refresh to table.
'get_default_domain' to be called 7 times.

Change-Id: I4b2c00a561c6b2404d6535fc1a1bf078652327e6
Implements: blueprint auto-refresh

commit_message:
[WIP] Third party extensions for neutron

This introduces the feature to load external tasks provided by
the user, in order to deploy a third party neutron plugin, instead
of providing always the code of the plugin and deployment in tree.

It allows more flexibility to the user, at the expense of risking
counter productive tasks and reducing the willingness to upstream
code.

Change-Id: I6b20a905d45e114c94c506f2d876ea4bd7491fc4

[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-12-03 22:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-12-04 00:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

-1 is for the nova conf change to change the default randome number source to /dev/random from /dev/urandom and the fact i dont think you are setting the image property for x86? just arm and power right or did i miss it?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-12-04 00:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-04 16:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-12-05 04:40:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I don't really feel that qualified to vote on the nova details here, but the basic implementation looks ok to me"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-12-05 06:52:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Is there a way to verify that this actually does what it claims?

I'm also worried that it may affect gate stability negatively, is anyone actually using this kind of setup in production? And if this makes for a better default experience, wouldn't it be better to make it the default in nova?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-05 10:37:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Is there a way to verify that this actually does what it claims?
 > 
 > I'm also worried that it may affect gate stability negatively, is
 > anyone actually using this kind of setup in production? And if this
 > makes for a better default experience, wouldn't it be better to
 > make it the default in nova?

Hmm, that's a good point. Which tests are failing? I went looking at the nova-compute logs for the Tempest job and couldn't see the RNG device in the XML for the various instances, however, this seems to be because we don't use the flavors created in 'lib/nova' but rather those created in 'lib/tempest' (m1.nano, by default). Do we need to modify that file too?"}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-12-05 15:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-12-05 16:00:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Is there a way to verify that this actually does what it claims?
 > >
 > > I'm also worried that it may affect gate stability negatively, is
 > > anyone actually using this kind of setup in production? And if
 > this
 > > makes for a better default experience, wouldn't it be better to
 > > make it the default in nova?
 > 
 > Hmm, that's a good point. Which tests are failing? I went looking
 > at the nova-compute logs for the Tempest job and couldn't see the
 > RNG device in the XML for the various instances, however, this
 > seems to be because we don't use the flavors created in 'lib/nova'
 > but rather those created in 'lib/tempest' (m1.nano, by default). Do
 > we need to modify that file too?

I've updated the change to include updates for the tempest flavors.

Testability was my concern too. I am definitely not the expert here was simply trying to get the ball rolling. I think questions of testing may be best deferred to nova?

As for checking if this improves gate stability I think this may be a case of merge and mark point in time against related e-r bugs. Then check again in a week and see if trends have changed. If they change for the better great. If there is no change or change for the worse we should consider reverting."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-12-05 16:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

so looking at https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/92b7918280e04fb9a92b8748adeab711/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#5698-5776

i dont think this is working'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-12-05 18:29:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > so looking at https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/92b7918280e04fb9a92b8748adeab711/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#5698-5776
 > 
 > i dont think this is working

That job ran against patchset 2 which stephenfin pointed out didn't update the tempest flavors. Patchset 3 fixes this and it appears to work now:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bcf95d776e1c40ed80b0c9051a65d757/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#2003-2005"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-12-05 18:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

yep that is exactly what i was hoping to see
this looks good to me.

it would be interestign is we notice any reduction in the time it takes test to run. we might not but if we had slow start up of service or intermittent failure it might. we also have considered enable the RNG by default so if we see an overall imporvemtne in stablity of execution time that might be a useful factor to condier for nova in the future.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-12-06 12:49:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

O.k., so let's do some live testing with this."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-12-08 14:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Similar to this change, see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697183/'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2019-12-08 14:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-12-08 23:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 22:35:51.000000000', 'message': "Enable libvirt virtio rng device

We've seen jobs where tests fail due to what appears to be rng
starvation. Enable virtio rng device to try and alleviate this.

Change-Id: I70d800cdc45b6008f775110f22c0000736421529
"}, {'created': '2019-12-04 16:06:53.000000000', 'message': "Enable libvirt virtio rng device

We've seen jobs where tests fail due to what appears to be rng

commit_message:
Enable libvirt virtio rng device

We've seen jobs where tests fail due to what appears to be rng
starvation. Enable virtio rng device to try and alleviate this.

Change-Id: I70d800cdc45b6008f775110f22c0000736421529

The filtering added to fix Bug: #1821377 filters any
network without a VIP address. This filtering is to
agressive and cause deployment failure when a management
network without a VIP is used.

Change-Id: If189eb6fc0b2dc2c78323a7c08f7e303be2b6124
Resolves: rhbz#1778719
Closes-Bug: #1854846
(cherry picked from commit af79ae34ad9a3ed1581c0f6df91fa1e3ef0f8433)
'}]
commit_message:
Relax filtering in krb-service-principals jinja

The filtering added to fix Bug: #1821377 filters any
network without a VIP address. This filtering is to
agressive and cause deployment failure when a management
network without a VIP is used.

Change-Id: If189eb6fc0b2dc2c78323a7c08f7e303be2b6124
Resolves: rhbz#1778719
Closes-Bug: #1854846
(cherry picked from commit af79ae34ad9a3ed1581c0f6df91fa1e3ef0f8433)

commit_message:
Adds DPDK support for Open vSwitch

This commit provides baseline changes to the os_neutron role
to support DPDK-accelerated Open vSwitch.

Change-Id: I08aba431d1546160e7c0311ad929762a018e0dca
Implements: dpdk support for openvswitch
Closes-Bug: #1784660

commit_message:
[OVN] Move OVN common.acl to Neutron tree

Moved networking-ovn.common.acl code to Neutron, related tests and
auxiliary code.

Previous paths in networking-ovn tree:
./networking_ovn/common/acl.py -> ./neutron/common/ovn/acl.py

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Rosen <aaronorosen@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Richard Theis <rtheis@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Han Zhou <zhouhan@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ovn-merge

commit_message:
Fix OVS-DPDK readiness probe for OVS < v2.10.0

A recently introduced readiness probe for OVS with DPDK makes use of an
OVSDB table entry 'dpdk_initialized' which does not exist in OVS
versions preceeding v2.10.0. This patch changes the readiness probe to
exit successfully if this table entry does not exit.

Change-Id: I1776ac4bf736220267a49042f1b7092f3cf5ed16

[{'created': '2019-12-03 15:44:24.000000000', 'message': "Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing

This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I088ee8fa3bfa6fa6ee16e2bba44c1435370354c3
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I088ee8fa3bfa6fa6ee16e2bba44c1435370354c3

[{'created': '2019-12-07 08:46:20.000000000', 'message': "Check conditional length before evaluation

Ceilometer sometimes may not be used. On a run through of Stein to Train
upgrade there is an error:

'Error while evaluating conditional ... list object has no element 0'

This patch ensures that the ansible group has members before trying to
reference the first group member.

Change-Id: I4ffba430d174a32e586fefd8ee636b6b8405486e
(cherry picked from commit c3c1a12c31e6dbbf320963bc13b1f14ce353815d)
"}]
commit_message:
Check conditional length before evaluation

Ceilometer sometimes may not be used. On a run through of Stein to Train
upgrade there is an error:

'Error while evaluating conditional ... list object has no element 0'

This patch ensures that the ansible group has members before trying to
reference the first group member.

Change-Id: I4ffba430d174a32e586fefd8ee636b6b8405486e
(cherry picked from commit c3c1a12c31e6dbbf320963bc13b1f14ce353815d)

Everywhere except Centos 7.

[{'created': '2019-12-03 14:52:15.000000000', 'message': 'Synchronize connection configuration for metrics

Currently there are cases when collectd is trying to connect to QDR
on different interface than QDR is listening for connections.

This patch makes sure that those services are always in sync. And also
is changing interior configuration to work based on IPs instead
of hostnames.

Change-Id: Ia865bef9daf5b7e92b1b8c3712113416c9c8c176
(cherry picked from commit 0e0b5a10f50f24b889cf4bf3165328e6505f8417)
'}]
commit_message:
Synchronize connection configuration for metrics

Currently there are cases when collectd is trying to connect to QDR
on different interface than QDR is listening for connections.

This patch makes sure that those services are always in sync. And also
is changing interior configuration to work based on IPs instead
of hostnames.

Change-Id: Ia865bef9daf5b7e92b1b8c3712113416c9c8c176
(cherry picked from commit 0e0b5a10f50f24b889cf4bf3165328e6505f8417)

commit_message:
bug: cluster creation without docker_volume_size

Allows cluster to be created without docker_volume_size where we were
previously seeing this error:

    TypeError: int() argument must be a string,
    a bytes-like object or a number, not 'NoneType'

Regression introduced in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695239/.

Change-Id: I6e10a7fd760102040415875164d267a729c24878
Story: 2005386
Task: 37565

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/696296/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 45m 20s'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-11-27 22:48:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

* i don't understand why you put these files here instead of neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn

* i don't understand why you submit very small patches like this. are these small patches testable independently? otherwise i'd suggest to submit the entire networking-ovn code as a single (or maybe a few) patch."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-11-28 08:41:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> * i don't understand why you put these files here instead of
 > neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn

We talked about it basically and we decided to move it here because those files are used not only by mech_driver but also by ovn metadata agent.

 > 
 > * i don't understand why you submit very small patches like this.
 > are these small patches testable independently? otherwise i'd
 > suggest to submit the entire networking-ovn code as a single (or
 > maybe a few) patch.

We decided to move it in more smaller patches, even if this will not be testable easy at once just to make it easier to debug and more logical in git history later.
This will not be considered as done until we will push patch with release note which will say that ovn driver is now in-tree finally. And than it will be testable in gate for sure."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-28 13:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-28 13:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-28 15:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-28 16:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-28 17:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

This code should go to
- agent.ovsdb.ovn.commands
- agent.ovsdb.ovn.worker
- agent.ovsdb.ovn.api'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-29 08:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> This code should go to
 > - agent.ovsdb.ovn.commands
 > - agent.ovsdb.ovn.worker
 > - agent.ovsdb.ovn.api

Why to agent? There is no agent using it.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-29 08:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

Rodolfo, I believe we should merge this patchset with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696621/1 because ovsdb/commands.py tests needs ovsdb/acl.py [1]


[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/master/networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_commands.py#L19'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-29 10:50:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> * i don't understand why you put these files here instead of
 > neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn
 > 
 > * i don't understand why you submit very small patches like this.
 > are these small patches testable independently? otherwise i'd
 > suggest to submit the entire networking-ovn code as a single (or
 > maybe a few) patch.

Each patch is going to be testable, that's why we are pushing small patches. Tests are coming in next PS.

Agree with having this code in neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-29 12:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-11-29 14:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

This patch imports ovsdb related code from networking_ovn.

Previous paths in networking-ovn tree:

could be tested properly.

commit_message:
Remove int to string conversion

Without this patch, int will get converted to string, which
is then applied in cron module, and is inconsistent with the other
string input (which the module expects). This can lead to failures.

This fixes it by ensuring everything is a string! boooo.

Change-Id: I3170cc2647947a0365543218f289480bab9ee4ce

commit_message:
HTK: Omit port from uri for http/https when 80/443 used

This PS updates htk to omit the port used in the url when this
corresponds to the standard ports for the http and https protocols.

Change-Id: I46e2237dde99460fd096bd6fe58fe154b220041f
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: Fix credential list for project members
messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-12-06 22:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-12-06 22:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLooks like a clean cherry-pick.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2019-12-06 22:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-07 18:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-06 22:25:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix credential list for project members

Without this patch, project members and readers can list any credentials
with the /v3/credentials API when enforce_scope is false. enforce_scope
is only applicable to project admins due to the admin-ness problem[1],
and this policy is not meant to allow project admins any access to users'
credentials (only system admins should be able to access them). However,
when enforce_scope is false, we need to preserve the old behavior of
project admins being able to list all credentials. This change mitigates
the problem by running the identity:get_credential policy check to
filter out credentials the user does not have access to. This will
impact performance.

Closes-bug: #1855080

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/968696

Change-Id: I5dd85a6b8368373a27aef2942a64499d020662ef
(cherry picked from commit 17c337dbdbfb9d548ad531c2ad0483c9bce5b98f)
(cherry picked from commit bd3f63787151183f4daa43578aa491856fefae5b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix credential list for project members

Without this patch, project members and readers can list any credentials
with the /v3/credentials API when enforce_scope is false. enforce_scope
is only applicable to project admins due to the admin-ness problem[1],
and this policy is not meant to allow project admins any access to users'
credentials (only system admins should be able to access them). However,
when enforce_scope is false, we need to preserve the old behavior of
project admins being able to list all credentials. This change mitigates
the problem by running the identity:get_credential policy check to
filter out credentials the user does not have access to. This will
impact performance.

Closes-bug: #1855080

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/968696

Change-Id: I5dd85a6b8368373a27aef2942a64499d020662ef
(cherry picked from commit 17c337dbdbfb9d548ad531c2ad0483c9bce5b98f)
(cherry picked from commit bd3f63787151183f4daa43578aa491856fefae5b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-26 18:16:47.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting

Previously simultaneous requests to reboot and delete an instance could
race as only the latter took a lock against the uuid of the instance.

With the Libvirt driver this race could potentially result in attempts
being made to reconnect previously disconnected volumes on the host.
Depending on the volume backend being used this could then result in
stale block devices point to unmapped volumes being left on the host
that in turn could cause failures later on when connecting newly mapped
volumes.

This change avoids this race by ensuring any request to reboot an
instance takes an instance.uuid lock within the compute manager,
serialising requests to reboot and then delete the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1838392
Change-Id: Ieb59de10c63bb067f92ec054535766cdd722dae2
(cherry picked from commit 9ad54f3dacbd372271f441baea5380f913072dde)
(cherry picked from commit 939cd9b177db8f12952e72145a5c00a0574959eb)
(cherry picked from commit 304d3f62a4e3bdbaab6fe7dd665174bc5b696d08)
(cherry picked from commit 7d14b6a5170821c65e55d7b39ccf4419a81640f8)
'}]
commit_message:
compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting

Previously simultaneous requests to reboot and delete an instance could
race as only the latter took a lock against the uuid of the instance.

With the Libvirt driver this race could potentially result in attempts
being made to reconnect previously disconnected volumes on the host.
Depending on the volume backend being used this could then result in
stale block devices point to unmapped volumes being left on the host
that in turn could cause failures later on when connecting newly mapped
volumes.

This change avoids this race by ensuring any request to reboot an
instance takes an instance.uuid lock within the compute manager,
serialising requests to reboot and then delete the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1838392
Change-Id: Ieb59de10c63bb067f92ec054535766cdd722dae2
(cherry picked from commit 9ad54f3dacbd372271f441baea5380f913072dde)
(cherry picked from commit 939cd9b177db8f12952e72145a5c00a0574959eb)
(cherry picked from commit 304d3f62a4e3bdbaab6fe7dd665174bc5b696d08)
(cherry picked from commit 7d14b6a5170821c65e55d7b39ccf4419a81640f8)

commit_message:
Remove murano from os-infra_containers

Murano is defenetely 3rd party component, which shouldn't be deployed
with os-infra_containers.

I can certainly do that but I was thinking it may be more appropriate to make it a separate bug report. Designate is not the only project that requires coordination when multiple workers are enabled (cinder is the other major one that comes to mind. It may help to have a separate bug report go through and add documentation where applicable. It could even be justified to display a warning in the Ansible run if multiple workers are enabled but the user has not enabled a coordination backend.

Let me know what you think. If you think it is better to add it in this commit I will gladly do so.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-17 16:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Could you follow the approach taken in this patch and make the coordination backend explicitly configurable?

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676261'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-09-17 18:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

LGTM - not super familiar with this portion of kolla, but there are other potential backends as well like zookeeper (or even memcached). Is there a way to support all of these?'}, {'account_id': 30740, 'date': '2019-09-17 19:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I can look into adding support for specific ones for designate. I was debating the idea of adding a global.yml option to configure a global coordination backend in K-A instead of having to enable it manually for every project that may need it.

I remember reading somewhere that Designate requires a coordination backend that supports leaders. Is that still true? If so we will need to take that into account because not all coordination backends are equal.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-18 06:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
[designate] Add coordination backend for designate workers

Add coordination backend configuration to designate.conf which is
required in multinode environments. Fixes warning from designate:

WARNING designate.coordination [-] No coordination backend configured,
assuming we are the only worker. Please configure a coordination backend

Change-Id: I23c4d2de7e3f9368795c423000a4f9a6c3a431e2
Closes-Bug: #1843842
Related-Bug: #1840070

need to rethink based on new observations'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-03 07:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

just checked in https://review.opendev.org/689660 that redis and *etcd3gw* are stable, just not etcd3 (a different driver we use by default) - it seems devstack uses etcd or etcd3gw (never etcd3, only tooz tests itself against it) - hence the "plan minimum" would be switching to etcd3gw, it could have better availability in repos too'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-03 07:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Review-Priority'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-03 13:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-03 13:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-04 17:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-04 17:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I do wonder what this change of default would do on an existing system using the etcd3 driver.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-04 17:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> I do wonder what this change of default would do on an existing
 > system using the etcd3 driver.

Make it stabler. :-)
The driver is used to talk to etcd3 so two services using different drivers should still lock properly.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-04 18:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > I do wonder what this change of default would do on an existing
 > > system using the etcd3 driver.
 > 
 > Make it stabler. :-)
 > The driver is used to talk to etcd3 so two services using different
 > drivers should still lock properly.

I don't think we can assume that. It entirely depends on how the drivers are using etcd."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-05 09:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

You have a point but what we need is a solution. :-)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-05 11:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> You have a point but what we need is a solution. :-)

I would prefer to keep it broken in some cases (given that people might have fixed via custom config) than break it where it is working already.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-05 12:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Testing upgrade'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-05 15:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

so now you know it upgrades fine but etcd3 driver is broken by itself'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-05 16:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Default to etcd3gw driver for etcd-based coordination

To fix instability and availability issues:

etcd3 is not available in repos for binary kolla images.

etcd3 does not support eventlet-based services [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/466098

Change-Id: I430bab735da204fc81696130b17931a89214c876
Closes-bug: #1852086
Closes-bug: #1854932

commit_message:
Honor --heat-user argument in heat launcher

Previously, the --heat-user argument was not honored, and the "heat"
user was assumed. This patch corrects the issue so that the user
specified by --heat-user is used by the heat launcher.

Change-Id: I5b4a93f652272c781fc57373a483a9c2289dc248

commit_message:
Don't include tuned tasks when checkmode

We don't get a tuned_check when in check mode so we should just skip the
config include.

Change-Id: Ic9d364d0f440b9308d57c2ebf07fbc12f6403c66
Closes-Bug: #1855502

commit_message:
Remove murano from os-infra_containers

Murano is defenetely 3rd party component, which shouldn't be deployed
with os-infra_containers.

Change-Id: Ie755877f7a62c65f03eb7dd9256606f4fd213206

commit_message:
Adds configuration for the Ironic Inspector

This commit enables and configures the Ironic Inspector. This feature
allows for baremetal nodes to be introspected. This provides useful
information about an Ironic host. Such information includes harware
and mac addresses.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/680553
Change-Id: I2ee09d9cc20f9b8e4430c55129cd8bac9435299d
(cherry picked from commit 7da7127071a33d2a5dcb750592c1fb9854bdbebb)

commit_message:
Check conditional length before evaluation

Ceilometer sometimes may not be used. On a run through of Stein to Train
upgrade there is an error:

'Error while evaluating conditional ... list object has no element 0'

This patch ensures that the ansible group has members before trying to
reference the first group member.

Change-Id: I4ffba430d174a32e586fefd8ee636b6b8405486e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-26 18:16:18.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting

Previously simultaneous requests to reboot and delete an instance could
race as only the latter took a lock against the uuid of the instance.

With the Libvirt driver this race could potentially result in attempts
being made to reconnect previously disconnected volumes on the host.
Depending on the volume backend being used this could then result in
stale block devices point to unmapped volumes being left on the host
that in turn could cause failures later on when connecting newly mapped
volumes.

This change avoids this race by ensuring any request to reboot an
instance takes an instance.uuid lock within the compute manager,
serialising requests to reboot and then delete the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1838392
Change-Id: Ieb59de10c63bb067f92ec054535766cdd722dae2
(cherry picked from commit 9ad54f3dacbd372271f441baea5380f913072dde)
(cherry picked from commit 939cd9b177db8f12952e72145a5c00a0574959eb)
(cherry picked from commit 304d3f62a4e3bdbaab6fe7dd665174bc5b696d08)
'}]
commit_message:
compute: Take an instance.uuid lock when rebooting

Previously simultaneous requests to reboot and delete an instance could
race as only the latter took a lock against the uuid of the instance.

With the Libvirt driver this race could potentially result in attempts
being made to reconnect previously disconnected volumes on the host.
Depending on the volume backend being used this could then result in
stale block devices point to unmapped volumes being left on the host
that in turn could cause failures later on when connecting newly mapped
volumes.

This change avoids this race by ensuring any request to reboot an
instance takes an instance.uuid lock within the compute manager,
serialising requests to reboot and then delete the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1838392
Change-Id: Ieb59de10c63bb067f92ec054535766cdd722dae2
(cherry picked from commit 9ad54f3dacbd372271f441baea5380f913072dde)
(cherry picked from commit 939cd9b177db8f12952e72145a5c00a0574959eb)
(cherry picked from commit 304d3f62a4e3bdbaab6fe7dd665174bc5b696d08)

https://discuss.linuxcontainers.org/t/apparmor-denied-operation-mount/2424/13

Install chrony on AIO

This patch updates the bootstrap-aio playbook to install chrony in
order to enable successful completion of the ansible-hardening tasks.

commit_message:
Networks may be none

If the network vars are defined but not lists, the filters and loops
fail in ansible. We need to check that vars exist and that they aren't
none prior to using them.

Change-Id: I648caf97b532c65a0b1e12e8b27be9997a69780d
Closes-Bug: #1855149
(cherry picked from commit f5c93fa2f12fe2eba08eac7326d348f25c0e7187)
